sub_topic: Determining the VSEPR geometry of a molecule
message_1: What is the VSEPR geometry of a molecule that has four electron pairs and two of them are lone pairs?
message_2: The VSEPR geometry of a molecule with four electron pairs and two of them being lone pairs is bent or V-shaped. This is because the two lone pairs occupy more space and repel the bonding pairs, causing the molecule to have a bent geometry.
